Key Match Events: Detroit Tigers rallied from a 3-0 deficit to win 4-3
Riley Greene singled off Garrett Cleavinger to tie the game in the eighth inning
Matt Vierling scored the winning run on Justyn-Henry Malloy's sacrifice fly in the eighth inning
Post-Match Reflections: A.J. Hinch expressed his belief in the team's ability to accomplish more
Kevin Cash acknowledged that the Tigers are doing a lot of good things right now
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rays' record of consecutive winning records ended after six seasons
The Tigers have won five straight games and are tied with Kansas City for the second and third American League wildcard spots
Others: The Rays fell two games behind the third-place Red Sox in the AL East
The Tigers' starter Tyler Alexander allowed four hits and struck out six without walking a batter
